{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2505.00286v1", "title": "A polytopal discrete de Rham scheme for the exterior calculus Einstein's
  equations", "summary": "In this work, based on the $3+1$ decomposition in [23, 32], we present a
fully exterior calculus breakdown of spacetime and Einstein's equations. Links
to the orthonormal frame approach [37] are drawn to help understand the
variables in this context. Two formulations are derived, discretised and tested
using the exterior calculus discrete de Rham complex [12], and some discrete
quantities are shown to be conserved in one of the cases.", "main_category": "gr-qc", "categories": "gr-qc,cs.NA,math.NA", "published": "2025-05-01T04:18:49Z"}
